benchmark_details.name: HUMOTO (Human Motions with Objects)
benchmark_details.overview: HUMOTO is a high-fidelity dataset of human-object interactions for motion generation, computer vision, and robotics applications, featuring 736 sequences (7,875 seconds at 30 fps) capturing interactions with 63 modeled objects and various activities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of HUMOTO is to provide a comprehensive dataset for advancing realistic human-object interaction modeling across various research domains.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to motion capture suit size constraints, the dataset includes only a single performer, which may introduce bias.

data.source: Captured from a custom motion capture setup utilizing dual-Kinect cameras and a motion capture suit.
data.annotation: Textual annotations provided at multiple levels, including concise titles and detailed scripts for each sequence.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as per defined formulas in the methodology, providing insights into motion quality and interaction realism.
methodology.interpretation: Lower foot sliding and jerk values indicate more natural motion, while MSNR values are used to compare motion quality against other datasets.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against other datasets like Mixamo, HUMOTO shows lower foot sliding and jerk, indicating high motion fidelity.
methodology.validation: Licensed industry professionals verified the motion and annotations for quality assurance.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Limited to single performer, which could introduce demographic bias.
